name: Hotel Lungarno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two rooms here for our three day stay in Florence. From the very first moment we were greeted kindly and happily. Both rooms were beautiful. One on the 3rd floor had a beautiful floor to ceiling view across the Arno. Our 6th floor room had a huge terrace and beautiful views of the Arno, the Ponte Vecchio and the Duomo ... it was heavenly.
reviews.title: I'm ready to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had lovely food and we had a perfect stay from start to finish. I wish I'd stayed at their establishment in Rome instead of the Hotel Eden (not bad, but not as special). The concierge was super helpful and the hotel comes with a fantastic discount at stores throughout Florence.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: When I go back to Florence, I'll be going back to Hotel Lungarno.
reviews.title: The only place I will stay in Firenze.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there 5 yrs ago and knew we had to return. This is subtly elegant but the best is the location - on the Arno w/ views of the Ponte Vechio from our room and bar terrace. This hotel is a stone's throw from the Piti Palace, Uffizi + Bargello museums.
reviews.title: Should be a five star!

likes.liked: — Beautiful room, great location, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Traveled with my grown daughter for her first trip to Italy.
reviews.title: The best

likes.disliked: — A bellhop who may have been use to really, really big tippers who seem to frequent the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel Lungarno based on its website and reviews from the TripAdvisor, however there were a few problems. The person who showed us to our room said not a single word, not one. None of our amenities–welcome drinks, fruit or car service to and from the airport/train station were mentioned or offered. We received the drinks and fruit after several requests. The other amenities; we just dropped, decided the staff was indifferent or overworked or both. On the first morning, we had no hot water, I telephoned and the desk person hung up on me at mid-sentence; after 20 minutes, my husband found the maid and she went for help. We were very disappointed with the overall attitude and poor service this hotel offered.
reviews.title: A Few Problems...
Get the apartment!
reviews.text: My wife and three young adult children stayed at the Hotel Lungarno for 4 nights, then again for one night later in our stay in Italy. With 5 people, we either had to choose 2 rooms or get one larger place. We chose one of the apartments at the hotel and it was a great choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the Vespucci apartment on the 4th floor of the hotel. It is large, bright and nicely appointed. We loved it!
reviews.title: Excellent location, beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderful. It is right on the river, has a great lobby and the staff is excellent. For a high-end boutique hotel you will not find a better place anywhere. Oh, by the way, it is owned by the Ferragamo family, so it is very tastefully decorated. All things considered, it is one of the nicest, most comfortable places I have stayed.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Lungarno

reviews.text: My husband and I spent a 3 night weekend (March 2007) at Hotel Lungarno, Florence and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel's location is excellent - it is within walking distance to all tourist attractions and about 2 minutes away from the Ponte Vecchio. The hotel is immaculate, as seen in the photograhs. The staff were very helpful, friendly and courteous. The rooms were serviced daily to a very high standard. Hotel Lungarno is not a cheap hotel. but if you have the extra cash to spend and want to spoil yourself - this is the hotel for you. The only negative was that we checked in very late and were allocated a room next to the elevators. Avoid these rooms if possible.
reviews.title: The Best Place to Stay In Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Lungarno is a great hotel which is situated right by the Ponte Vecchio. The hotel staff was great and they helped make our honeymoon very special. Management upgraded our suite, they had roses and champagne waiting in our room and they just couldn't do enough.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Florence!

likes.disliked: — Being close to the ponte Vecchio can make the evengs loud sometimes.

reviews.text: The first room we had was extremely dramatic and was part of the original structure built over 500 years ago. Please look at my pictures and you'll see the loft room which was very castle like. Later in our stay we moved to a smaller room but one that had a great view.
reviews.title: Mixed results

likes.disliked: — Room # 2 - very small & without any views

reviews.text: The concierge is top notch and the bar and lounge area is quite nice. A very well trained staff which of course, makes all the difference!
reviews.title: Call this a large handsome boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Lungarno is the fashionista’s working hotel in Florence – it is owned by the Ferragamo family & while I was there, I saw Narciso Rodriguez checking in. The interior design is flawless.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel in Florence

reviews.text: I had a mixed experience with this hotel, as my stay was split into 2. For the 1st portion, I absolutely loved it. I had a breathtaking view and large, modern yet sensual room. Then for the next portion I had a small room without a view. It’s possible that I still would have liked it, had I not been spoiled by the 1st room. I requested to change it, but was told that there were no other rooms available – I can believe this as it was busy & it’s a fairly small hotel. End of story.
reviews.title: A truly remarkable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you choose any hotel in Florence and don't mind spending some money, I can't think of a better spot than Hotel Lungarno. The setting on the banks of the river is nothing short of breathtaking (be sure to bring a drink out onto the terrace), and walking distance to just about everything. The hotel's amenties are wonderful...the bed was unbelievably luxurious and comfortable. Our only regret was that we only had one night to enjoy here. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Spectacular location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In our minds, it's the only hotel in Florence. It is simply wonderful - everything you could want from a classic hotel in such a classic city. We love it.
reviews.title: Luscious Lungarno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently traveled to Europe for our honeymoon and Florence was one of our stops. The hotel Lungarno is a boutique hotel with tons of great amenities, and little extras. The bath products were fabulous although the bathroom was rather small. But the room was awesome, we opted for a river view on a high floor. The room is nautical style with dark wood and creams and navy. Very chic. We had a direct view of the Duomo cathedral. The staff was so friendly and helpful. We never ate at the restaurant but it smelt delicious. There was a little, Italian grocery store down to the left of the hotel, where we brought back sanwhiches and baked goods and sat at the hotel's riverside table area. The hotel is located just on the other side of the bridge from the more touristy area of Florence. The location was great to sit and watch people on the Ponte Vecchio. We would definitely stay here again! Florence is a lovely town and very easy to navigate. We cant wait to come back. Thank you hotel Lungarno for making our stay so memorable and special.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel right on the Arno River

likes.liked: — The location is great and the hotel is chic and modern, great to realx in the front lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great accommodations, location and service. The bar was a perfect spot for a drink and the restaurant was a nice respite from the other restaurants in Florence. The location is close to everything but seems far away. No crowds!!! The Hotel is typical of the quality you find with anything that has the Ferragammo name attached to it. Worth the trip to Florence just to sit on your own terrace viewing the Ponte Vechio and Arno.
reviews.title: Gracious Hotel on the Arno

reviews.text: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment adjoining the hotel in September for 3 nights. The Apartment on the 1st floor was beautifully decorated with a kitchenette but no laundry facilities or view, which meant it was a little on the dark side. We had a lovely small balcony onto the street.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel

likes.disliked: — Ordinary housekeeping - see mini bar comments

description: Your charming home away from home, a stone throw away from Ponte Vecchio. Florence and Tuscan hospitality are experienced at its finest in this splendid setting offering stunning views on the master works of the Renaissance.The exclusive and stylish Hotel Lungarno was designed by the Florentine architect Michele Bönan and invites you to spend magical days surrounded by luxury, glamorous art and culture.
